results.title: A Metformin-Responsive Metabolic Pathway Controls Distinct Steps in Gastric Progenitor Fate Decisions and Maturation.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Pyruvate_Carboxylase_Deficiency_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015324 @@@PC@@@-specific deletion of AMPKalpha or @GENE_PPARGC1A @GENE_19017 @@@PGC1alpha@@@ causes defective @<m>DISEASE_Pyruvate_Carboxylase_Deficiency_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015324 @@@PC@@@ maturation, which could not be rescued by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Miao ZF, Adkins-Threats M, Burclaff JR, Osaki LH, Sun JX, Kefalov Y, He Z, Wang ZN, Mills JC. A Metformin-Responsive Metabolic Pathway Controls Distinct Steps in Gastric Progenitor Fate Decisions and Maturation. Cell Stem Cell. 2020 Jun 4;26(6):910-925.e6. PMID: 32243780

results.title: Autistic-like behavior and cerebellar dysfunction in Bmal1 mutant mice ameliorated by mTORC1 inhibition
results.text_hl: Interestingly, the antidiabetic drug @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ reversed mTORC1 hyperactivation and alleviated major behavioral and @<m>DISEASE_Pyruvate_Carboxylase_Deficiency_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015324 @@@PC deficits@@@ in @GENE_ARNTL @GENE_11865 @@@Bmal1@@@ KO @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Liu D, Nanclares C, Simbriger K, Fang K, Lorsung E, Le N, Amorim IS, Chalkiadaki K, Pathak SS, Li J, Gewirtz JC, Jin VX, Kofuji P, Araque A, Orr HT, Gkogkas CG, Cao R. Autistic-like behavior and cerebellar dysfunction in Bmal1 mutant mice ameliorated by mTORC1 inhibition Mol Psychiatry. 2022 Mar 17;():. PMID: 35301425
